description: Complete analysis of Bluebook Rule 10 with all subrules, error types, regex patterns, examples, and rule references

10.1.title: Basic Citation Forms
10.1.description: Full case citation structure including case name, reporter volume, reporter abbreviation, first page, pinpoint page, court abbreviation, and year

error_types.description: Citation begins with reporter number without case name
Citation missing reporter abbreviation between volume and page numbers
Reporter abbreviation followed directly by year without page numbers
Citation ends with page number without year in parentheses

error_types.error_type: Case name not italicized in academic writing
error_types.description: Case name should be italicized in academic writing (underscored or starred)
error_types.incorrect_example: According to Roe v. Wade, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

error_types.description: Reporter abbreviation has incorrect format or capitalization
Volume number contains excessive digits or incorrect formatting
If citing multiple reporters, abbreviations should be consistent
Pin-cite should be separated from first page
Page numbers should use proper range format

10.2.title: Case Names
10.2.description: Rules for formatting case names in citations, including omitting names, abbreviations, and party selection

error_types.error_type: First names or initials included in case name
error_types.description: Case name includes first names or initials (should be last names only)
error_types.incorrect_example: John Doe v. Jane Smith, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

error_types.error_type: Middle names or initials in case name
error_types.description: Middle names or initials included when they should be omitted
error_types.incorrect_example: John Michael Doe v. Jane Sarah Smith, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

error_types.error_type: The included at start of party name
error_types.description: Case name starts with 'The' which should be omitted
error_types.incorrect_example: The United States v. Nixon, 418 U.S. 683 (1974)

error_types.error_type: Multiple parties on same side not separated
error_types.description: Multiple parties on same side should be abbreviated to first party only
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith and Jones v. Brown, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

error_types.description: Alternative names like AKA or d/b/a should be omitted
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones AKA Brown, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

error_types.error_type: Geographic unit not abbreviated in case name
error_types.description: State or country names in party names should be abbreviated per Table T10
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. State of California, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

error_types.description: Entity names should be abbreviated per Table T6 (Co., Inc., etc.)

error_types.error_type: In re or Ex parte case name format error
error_types.description: In re or Ex parte should be properly formatted without omitting space
Case name should use 'v.' not 'versus'

error_types.error_type: Ampersand used instead of proper abbreviation in entity name
error_types.description: Ampersand should be written as & per T6 only in specific contexts, not as first word substitute
Entity names should be complete

error_types.error_type: Incorrect et al. in case name
error_types.description: Et al. should not appear in case name

10.2.1.title: General Rules for Case Names
10.2.1.description: Omit first names, middle names, initials. Omit The as first word. Use acronyms when widely known, abbreviate per Table T6

error_types.error_type: Full name used instead of last name only
error_types.description: First and last names should be reduced to last name only

error_types.error_type: The not omitted from beginning of case name
error_types.description: The as first word of case name should always be omitted
NLRB and similar widely known acronyms should be used
error_types.incorrect_example: National Labor Relations Board v. Jones

error_types.error_type: Table T6 abbreviation not applied to entity name
error_types.description: Corporation should be abbreviated to Corp. per T6

error_types.error_type: Incomplete T6 abbreviations in entity names
error_types.description: Entity designation words should be abbreviated per T6
Use proper abbreviations per T6
Ampersand usage needs T6 verification

10.2.2.title: Additional Rules for Case Names in Citations
10.2.2.description: Omit all parties other than first on each side. Omit alternative names. Use In re or Ex parte appropriately

error_types.error_type: All defendants listed instead of first only
error_types.description: Only first party on each side of v. should be cited
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, Brown, and Davis

error_types.error_type: Ex rel. clause included without proper formatting
error_types.description: Ex rel. should be properly formatted and spaced
error_types.correct_example: Smith ex rel. Brown v. Jones

error_types.error_type: Geographic unit abbreviation missing from party name
error_types.description: Geographic units in party names should be abbreviated per T10
Case name order should reflect appellant v. appellee or original case order
error_types.incorrect_example: Jones v. Smith (when Smith should be first)

error_types.description: Ex rel. needs proper spacing

10.3.title: Reporters and Other Sources
10.3.description: Cite to published reporters according to their citation format. Include series designation when applicable

error_types.description: Reporter abbreviation should follow official Bluebook designations
Second, third series should be indicated (2d, 3d) when applicable
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E. 113 (should be N.E.2d)

error_types.description: Verify series designation matches actual reporter publication
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 S.E.2d 113 (when should be 3d)

error_types.error_type: Unofficial reporter cited when official exists
error_types.description: Official reporters (like U.S.) should be cited when available
error_types.incorrect_example: 410 S. Ct. 113 (should cite to U.S. if available)

error_types.description: Verify series designation accuracy
Regional reporters may need court designation

10.3.1.title: Parallel Citations and Which Source(s) to Cite
10.3.1.description: Rules for multiple reporter citations and selecting which source to cite

error_types.description: Parallel citations to state reporter should be included when available
Official reporter should come first in parallel citations

error_types.error_type: Incorrect citation order for multiple reporters
error_types.description: Citation order should reflect precedence (official before unofficial)
Some cases require all major reporter parallel citations

10.3.2.title: Reporters
10.3.2.description: Citation format requirements specific to various reporter types

error_types.description: Federal reporters should use F., F.2d, F.3d not Fed.
Supreme Court Reporter should be abbreviated S. Ct.

error_types.error_type: National Reporter Series region designation missing
error_types.description: Regional reporters need designation (N.E., S.E., etc.)
Federal Appendix should be cited as F. App'x not F.A.
Reporter series should be properly designated

10.3.3.title: Public Domain Format
10.3.3.description: Citation format for public domain citations without volume/page

error_types.error_type: Public domain format missing court designation
error_types.description: Public domain citation must include court designation

error_types.error_type: Public domain citation year format incorrect
error_types.description: Public domain citation should use full year format
Public domain should include paragraph numbers when needed

10.4.title: Court and Jurisdiction
10.4.description: Rules for including court abbreviations when not obvious from reporter name

error_types.error_type: Missing court designation for non-obvious reporter
error_types.description: Non-obvious reporters need court abbreviation in parentheses

error_types.error_type: Unnecessary court designation for obvious reporter
error_types.description: Obvious reporters (like U.S.) do not need court designation
Court names should be abbreviated per Table T1

error_types.error_type: Court designation incorrect for Federal Circuit
error_types.description: Federal Circuit should use (Fed. Cir. not (Fed.)
Circuit courts should be designated as (1st Cir., 2nd Cir., etc.
Use Table T1 for state abbreviations
Abbreviations need proper periods
Use specific court, not generic terms

10.5.title: Date or Year
10.5.description: Rules for including dates or years in parentheses following reporter citations

error_types.description: Citation must include year in parentheses
Year should be in parentheses following page number

error_types.error_type: Full date used instead of year only
error_types.description: Citations should use year only, not full date
Year should be full four-digit format

error_types.error_type: Court designation and year both missing from parentheses
error_types.description: Parentheses must contain at minimum the year
Years must be four digits
Only one year parenthetical needed

10.6.title: Parenthetical Information Regarding Cases
10.6.description: Rules for using parenthetical information about case holdings and weight of authority

error_types.description: Case citation should include brief holding in parenthetical
Parenthetical information should start with lowercase (except proper nouns)
Parentheticals should use past tense
Parentheticals should paraphrase, not quote extensively
error_types.incorrect_example: (holding that "the plaintiff was found to be negligent in failing to observe the traffic light")

error_types.description: [sic] only for actual text errors
Use clear language for ruling direction

10.6.1.title: Weight of Authority
10.6.1.description: Parentheticals indicating strength of authority (overruled, reversed, etc.)

error_types.error_type: Missing overruled parenthetical when case is overruled
error_types.description: Overruled or reversed cases should include this in parenthetical
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E.2d 113 (1980), reversed by

error_types.description: Use proper format for authority changes
Vacated cases need proper citation to vacating authority
Cite overruling case in full

10.6.2.title: In-Chambers Opinions
10.6.2.description: Parenthetical information for in-chambers or related procedural designations

error_types.description: In-chambers opinions should be indicated in parenthetical
Per curiam should be lowercase italicized
Memorandum opinions need (mem.) designation

10.6.3.title: Quoting/Citing Parentheticals in Case Citations
10.6.3.description: Format and usage of parentheticals containing quotes or citations

error_types.error_type: Quote in parenthetical not properly attributed
error_types.description: Quoted material in parentheticals should use proper quoting verbs
Parenthetical quotes should be brief (50 words or less)
error_types.incorrect_example: (stating that "pursuant to the established doctrines of negligence law, where a party fails to exercise reasonable care...")
error_types.correct_example: (holding that negligence requires breach of duty)

error_types.description: Multiple citations need proper formatting
Holding parenthetical should precede citing parenthetical

error_types.error_type: Multiple parentheticals not separated by space
error_types.description: Multiple parentheticals should be separated by a space
Parentheticals need space between them

10.7.title: Prior and Subsequent History
10.7.description: Rules for indicating prior and subsequent proceedings of a case

error_types.error_type: Missing subsequent history for reversed case
error_types.description: Cases that were reversed should include the reversal in the citation
Subsequent history should use proper connector words
Prior and subsequent history should use proper connectors
Include court in subsequent history citation
History should be chronological

10.7.1.title: Explanatory Phrases and Weight of Authority
10.7.1.description: Proper language for describing case history (affirmed, reversed, vacated, etc.)

error_types.error_type: Incorrect abbreviation for case history term
error_types.description: Use proper abbreviations (aff'd, rev'd, vacated, remanded)
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E.2d 113 (1980), aff'd by...

error_types.error_type: Using past tense instead of abbreviated form
error_types.description: Use abbreviated forms (rev'd, vacated, aff'd) in citations
History phrases need proper connectives (e.g., 'by')
Specify scope of modification

10.7.2.title: Different Case Name on Appeal
10.7.2.description: Rules when case name changes on appeal

error_types.error_type: Different appellate case name not indicated
error_types.description: If case name differs on appeal, show both names with proper formatting
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E.2d 113 (1980), rev'd by 410 U.S. 113 (1981)
error_types.correct_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E.2d 113 (1980), rev'd, *Jones v. Smith*, 410 U.S. 113 (1981)

error_types.error_type: Case name change not properly formatted
error_types.description: Sub nom. should introduce different case name in proper format
Sub nom. and case name should be italicized

10.8.title: Special Citation Forms
10.8.description: Citation formats for pending cases, unreported cases, and special materials

error_types.error_type: Pending case cited with publication year
error_types.description: Pending cases should not include case year, use (2024) not (pending 1980)
Unreported cases should include docket number or case number
Unpublished opinions should cite to accessible database or file
Distinguish pending from unreported
Clarify whether case is published
error_types.correct_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E.2d 113 (2024) or No. 20-0001

10.8.1.title: Pending and Unreported Cases
10.8.1.description: Citation format for cases not yet published or still pending

error_types.description: Pending cases should include docket number
Docket number format should match court's format
Recent cases should specify whether reported or unreported
error_types.correct_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E.2d 113 (2024) or Smith v. Jones, No. 20-CV-001 (2024) (unreported)

error_types.description: Specify stage of pending case
Include database or file location for unreported cases
error_types.correct_example: Smith v. Jones, No. 20-0001 (Ohio Ct. App. 2024) (unreported)

10.8.2.title: Fifth Circuit Split
10.8.2.description: Specific citation format for Fifth Circuit panel decisions that split on an issue

error_types.error_type: Fifth Circuit split not properly indicated
error_types.description: Circuits with panel splits should indicate the split in parenthetical
error_types.correct_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 F.3d 113 (5th Cir. 1980) (panel split)

error_types.description: Use specific format for circuit splits per Bluebook
Identify Fifth Circuit panel splits
error_types.correct_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 F.3d 113 (5th Cir.) (panel split)

10.8.3.title: Briefs, Court Filings, and Transcripts
10.8.3.description: Citation format for briefs and other court filings

error_types.description: Briefs should specify type (Brief for Appellant, etc.)
error_types.correct_example: Brief for Appellant, Smith v. Jones, No. 20-0001 (filed...)

error_types.description: Court transcript should include page or record reference
error_types.correct_example: Transcript at 25, Smith v. Jones, 400 U.S. 113 (1980)

error_types.description: Court filings should use proper abbreviations
error_types.incorrect_example: Motion to Dismiss, Smith v. Jones
error_types.correct_example: Mot. to Dismiss, Smith v. Jones, No. 20-0001 (filed...)

error_types.description: Include page numbers in record citations
Use proper format for affidavit citations

10.8.4.title: Court Administrative Orders
10.8.4.description: Citation format for administrative orders and rules

error_types.error_type: Administrative order without proper court designation
error_types.description: Administrative orders must specify issuing court
error_types.correct_example: Administrative Order No. 001, U.S. Dist. Ct. N.D. Cal. (1980)

error_types.error_type: Order number format missing or incorrect
error_types.description: Orders should include order number designation
Specify which court's rule
error_types.correct_example: U.S. Dist. Ct. N.D. Ill. L.R. 1

error_types.description: Include order number

10.9.title: Short Forms for Cases
10.9.description: Rules for shortening case citations after full citation

error_types.error_type: Short form used without prior full citation
error_types.description: Short forms can only be used after full citation has been given

error_types.error_type: Id. used incorrectly with different source
error_types.description: Id. can only be used for immediately preceding source
error_types.incorrect_example: [Previous cite: Smith v. Jones] Jones v. Brown... Id., 400 N.E.2d
error_types.correct_example: [Previous cite: Smith v. Jones] Id., 400 N.E.2d at 115

error_types.error_type: Supra used without clear prior citation
error_types.description: Supra should reference specific note or location
Hereinafter should be in brackets after full citation
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E.2d 113 hereinafter SJ

error_types.description: Short forms should omit reporter citations and year parentheses
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E.2d 113 (1980) [as short form]

error_types.description: Short forms should include pin-cite page number
Use consistent short form throughout
Verify note number exists
Use abbreviation consistently after introduction
Cannot use short form without prior full citation

rule_reference.source: Bluebook: A Uniform System of Citation (21st Edition)
rule_reference.section: Part II - Case Names and Citations
